page.title: 19LANGUAGE AT COMMONSIDE
page.content: THE NATIVES OF COMMONSIDE SPEAK A BROAD LOWLAND SCOT'S DIALECT AS WELL AS THE ENGLISH LEARNED AT SCHOOL.THEY ARE IN A SENSE BI-LINGUAL.WORDS PECULIAR TO THE DIALECT:- {AIRT} DIRECTION. {KEB} ABORTION. {AWALD} LYING ON BACK AND UNABLE TO RISE. {RACKIT} STRETCHED;NOISE.{ {BAGGIES}MINNOWS. {SCUNNERED} DISGUSTED {BUIST} BRAND.{SLAISTER} MESS {CATTLE} {CLOSE} CATTLE COURT.{STELL}SHELTER. {CUSHIE} PIGEON.{SCOOR}DIAHOREA IN ANIMALS.{CLEUCH} STEEP CUTTING ON HILLS.{SKLENT}NOT STRAIGHT.{COUPIT} OVERTURNED.{SPEER}QUESTION{.DREIGH} DISMAL.{THOLE}PUT UP WITH.{FAIR FASHT} VERY TROUBLED.{TISHIE LAGGIE}WILD RHUBARB{.THOWLESS }LAZY,BRAINLESS. {GLAUR HOLE} MUDDY PLACE.{WHAUP } CURLEW{.HASSLE }STRUGGLE{.HOWK}DIG. {MEI}ME.{YOW }YOU{.YAIZE}USE .{FANKLE TANGLE.{WHEEST }TO BE QUIET.
